level.heading: ROLLING CASH 5โข PRIZE POOL, PRIZE STRUCTURE AND PROBABILITY OF WINNING (ยง0-921)

level.text: The prize pool for all prize categories shall consist of fifty-seven percent (57%) of each drawing period sales.
The Rolling Cash 5 TM game with a rolling jackpot and fixed payout game for lower tier prizes, which pays prizes based on a one-dollar ($1) bet are as follows:
Number of Matches Per Play
All five (5) winning numbers on a single lettered game board
Jackpot
Any four (4) winning numbers on a single lettered game board
Any three (3) winning numbers on a single lettered game board
Any two (2) winning numbers on a single lettered game board
The Rolling Cash 5 TM Jackpot prize shall be determined on a pari-mutuel basis for each draw and shall consist of forty-five point twenty percent (45.20%) of the prize pool.

If the Rolling Cash 5TM Jackpot is not won in a drawing, the prize money allocated for the Jackpot prize shall roll over and be added to the next Rolling Cash 5 TM Jackpot prize pool for the next drawing and the process is repeated until there is a Rolling Cash 5 TM Jackpot prizewinner.
If there are more than one Rolling Cash 5 TM Jackpot prizewinners for any draw, then the Jackpot amount will be shared by each Jackpot prizewinners on a pari-mutuel basis.

The Agency may offer guaranteed minimum jackpot prize amounts or minimum increases in the Jackpot prize between drawings or make other changes in the allocation of prize money where the Agency finds that it would be in the best interest of the game.

The following table sets forth the probability of winning and the probable distribution of winners in and among each prize category, based upon the total number of possible combinations in Rolling Cash 5 TM game.
Number of Matches Per Ticket
Probability Distribution
Number of Winners
Probable Set Prize Amount
Percentage Allocation to Prize
Any five (5) winning numbers on a single lettered game board
Jackpot
Any four (4) winning numbers on a single lettered game board
Any three (3) winning numbers. on a single lettered game board
Any two (2) winning numbers on a single lettered game board
Overall

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Final Rulemaking published at 43 DCR 5110 (September 20 1996) and 53 DCR 299 (January 13, 2006).
